title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 April 2014 - XWiki
content:

08:45 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:48 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, what is the best way to bind parameters to hql query? $services.query.hql("statement where doc.name = :var").bindValue("var", $doc.name").execute() fails, if $doc.name contains unsafe characters (doc name "Lorem ipsum 'dolor'" is binded as "statement where doc.name = 'Lorem ipsum 'dolor''" , which is not correct)  
08:52 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <DarkKnightCZ> $xwiki.searchDocuments($hql, [$param]); is unsafe too  
08:58 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <DarkKnightCZ> oh, my bad, wrong line :)  
09:04 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:07 <cjd> 08:57 < DarkKnightCZ> $xwiki.searchDocuments($hql, [$param]); is unsafe too <-- that should be safe as long as $hql is a constant  
09:08 <cjd> oh I suppose the $hql is implying that it's not xD  
09:10 <DarkKnightCZ> cjd: yup, i've been looking into wrong line :)  
09:10 <vmassol> has quit  
09:12 <ekarlso> has quit  
09:28 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:39 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <evalica> has quit  
11:16 <OSIMasson> has quit  
11:21 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:32 <ClemensR> If I want to add translations for a macro from xwiki-platform, I just add the keys to the ApplicationResources.properties ? (Even if the macro is in xwiki-rendering, e.g the ContentMacro)  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> Guys, if some day we plan to use GIT for our pages history, and we still need a SQL language to perform queries on it, maybe this could help: https://github.com/cloudson/gitql  
11:41 <vmassol> ClemensR: macro is in platform or rendering?  
11:41 <ClemensR> Content macro is in rendering  
11:41 <vmassol> the best is to add ApplicationResources.properties in the JAR of the macro  
11:42 <ClemensR> there is also Translation macro in platform missing keys  
11:42 <ClemensR> ah ok  
11:42 <vmassol> we used to add the macro keys in platform  
11:42 <vmassol> but that was before we added support for ApplicationResources.properties in the JAR  
11:42 <vmassol> you could send an email proposing that we officially do this from now on too :)  
11:42 <vmassol> (since I don't think this was officially discussed)  
11:42 <ClemensR> ah, ok, so one  ApplicationResources.properties  per macro (or its \*.jar) would be appropriate  
11:42 <vmassol> but it seems beftter to me  
11:43 <vmassol> yes  
11:43 <ClemensR> ok, will send mail to list then  
11:43 <vmassol> thanks  
11:43 <vmassol> (I'm at a conference in paris ATM, a bit busy ;))  
11:43 <vmassol> (till tomorrow)  
11:44 <ClemensR> yes, thought so. me first testing that it works as expected ;)  
11:44 <vmassol> it should :)  
11:44 <vmassol> it has to be at the root  
11:45 <vmassol> see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Localization+Module#HProvidetranslationbundleinajar  
11:48 <ClemensR> yes, ok, I see, thanks!  
11:50 <vmassol> has quit  
11:54 <ClemensR> ah, but it is already mentioned at the http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ApplicationDevelopmentBestPractices  ... or is this "just for applications" ?  
11:54 <ClemensR> (meh, me too late)

15:37 <ClemensR> seems I broke jenkins, sorry

15:48 <cjd> java1.6 ?  
15:52 <ClemensR> on jenkins? I hope not. .... its a fluke in some livetable changes not arriving in time, it seems  
15:52 <cjd> oh ok  
15:53 <cjd> I didn't check but "broken on jenkins, works on local" always reminds me of javac versions  
15:56 <ClemensR> ah, it got fixed mysteriously with the next commit :-/  
15:57 <cjd> flickerbug
